metadata.Title: CVE-2022-31629 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In PHP versions before 7.4.31, 8.0.24 and 8.1.11, the vulnerability enables network and same-site attackers to set a standard insecure cookie in the victim's browser which is treated as a `__Host-` or `__Secure-` cookie by PHP applications.

notes.Note: sbeattie> PEAR issues should go against php-pear as of xenial

criterions.comment: php5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
